intro: Macoubea fasciculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Macoubea fasciculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
